summary: Porto is Portugal's second-largest city, located in the north. It's an ancient place, once part of the Roman Empire. The city's name might have inspired the country's name, Portugal. Porto is famous for Port wine, named after the city's wine cellars. The historic center is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, featuring the Luiz I Bridge and Serra do Pilar Monastery. With a population of around 1.8 million in its metropolitan area, Porto is a significant urban center and a popular tourist destination.
title: Porto
